attributes.action: prosecute Crown Prosecution Service solicitors who fail to observe the law as laid down in the 1985 Prosecution of Offences Act  when it comes to bringing sex offenders before the courts.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The law states that the CPS have to prosecute an offender in accordance with the guide lines which are laid down in the Guide for Crown Prosecutors. This states that a prosecution must be in the public interest and that there must be a reasonable prospect of gaining a conviction. In rape and sexual assault  cases the CPS do not at present follow the law. This disregard of the law is no longer acceptable.
